HEADLINE: Reddit, Acting Against Hate Speech, Bans ‘The_Donald’ Subreddit
SUMMARY: The influential pro-Trump community broke the rules on harassment and targeting, said Reddit, which also banned other groups.

HEADLINE: Twitch Suspends Trump’s Channel for ‘Hateful Conduct’
SUMMARY: The action appeared to be the first outright suspension of one of the president’s social media accounts.

HEADLINE: Uber Makes Offer to Buy Postmates Delivery Service
SUMMARY: The ride-hailing company has been trying to expand its food-delivery business to compensate for the collapse of its main business.

HEADLINE: The New York Times Pulls Out of Apple News
SUMMARY: The Times said Apple News did not align with its strategy of building direct relationships with paying readers.

HEADLINE: How to Dig Up Family History Online
SUMMARY: Digitized newspaper archives and hyperlocal historical sources can help you understand how your ancestors lived.

HEADLINE: Two Gamers Played ‘The Last of Us Part II.’ They Were Blown Away.
SUMMARY: When the original video game was transcendental, can a sequel top it? Two Times reporters debate the answer.

HEADLINE: Tackling the Unsolvable Problem: The Bottomless Email Inbox
SUMMARY: For $99 a year, Hey wants to help us restore some control. The new service has a way to go — and so does email, come to think of it.

HEADLINE: What Are Fintechs and How Can They Help Small Business?
SUMMARY: Online financial service companies are filling a gap, especially as companies have altered how they work.

HEADLINE: Contact Tracing With Your Phone: It’s Easier but There Are Tradeoffs
SUMMARY: Lots of new app ideas are emerging to track Covid-19, but each has issues around privacy, location accuracy and how much appeal it will have to the public and to health officials.

HEADLINE: F.B.I. Warns of Fraudulent Coronavirus Antibody Tests
SUMMARY: Scammers are out to get personal information that could lead to identity theft.

HEADLINE: India Bans Nearly 60 Chinese Apps, Including TikTok and WeChat
SUMMARY: The move is part of the tit-for-tat retaliation after the Indian and Chinese militaries clashed earlier this month.

HEADLINE: A TikTok Twist on ‘PizzaGate’
SUMMARY: Young people have tweaked the conspiracy, and today’s internet sites help spread such false ideas.

HEADLINE: For Lesbians, TikTok Is ‘the Next Tinder’
SUMMARY: Young women feeling alienated by dating apps and bar culture are finding love on their For You pages.

HEADLINE: The Long, Unhappy History of Working From Home
SUMMARY: As the coronavirus keeps spreading, employers are convinced remote work has a bright future. Decades of setbacks suggest otherwise.

HEADLINE: What Do You Do When Extremism Comes for the Hawaiian Shirt?
SUMMARY: Worn by extremists toting assault rifles, the shirt has gone from dad symbol to battle flag.

HEADLINE: TikTok Is Shaping Politics. But How?
SUMMARY: Two researchers have studied political expression on the app since the Musical.ly era. Here’s what they found.

HEADLINE: ‘PizzaGate’ Conspiracy Theory Thrives Anew in the TikTok Era
SUMMARY: The false theory targeting Democrats, now fueled by QAnon and teenagers on TikTok, is entangling new targets like Justin Bieber.

HEADLINE: EBay’s Critics Faced an Extreme Case of an Old Silicon Valley Habit
SUMMARY: Six former employees were recently named in federal charges that were an indication of the lengths some companies will go to hit back at detractors.

HEADLINE: Facebook Adds Labels for Some Posts as Advertisers Pull Back
SUMMARY: Posts about voting will direct viewers to accurate information, and violations from important political figures will be marked “newsworthy.”
